Method Detail

spawn

public final Production spawn(int n)
This creates a child of the production given its index. This adds the child to the production and sets the parent for the newly created child production.

Parameters:
n - the index on the right hand side where the child attaches
Returns:
The newly created child

spawn

public final Production spawn(int n,
                              Production prod)
This creates a child of the production given its index. This adds the child to the production and sets the parent for the newly created child production. The new child production will be a copy of the production input as a parameter.

Parameters:
n - the index on the right hand side where the child attaches
prod - the production to copy the child from
Returns:
The newly created child

equals

public final boolean equals(Production p)
This returns true if the given production matches this one. The comparison checks for identical productions only, down to the placement of the dot.

Parameters:
p - The production to compare to.

public void print()
Easy print.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Standard toString human-readable output. Format: startpos left-- right1 . right2 with the dot moving about accordingly.
